concept.title: Simple Lists
concept.shortdesc: The simple list is usually a short series of items. This is what you use most of the time.

ul.li: Each list item is a single word or concept phrase.
Only punctuate a simple list if the list items are complete sentences.
You can include a parenthetical thought or phrase.

conbody.note: If a simple list is over half a page long, consider putting it into a multicolumn table. If the list exceeds an entire page in length, put it in a table.

example.title: Example Very Simple List
example.p: Note that the introductory sentence ends in a colon.
example.codeblock:
Following is a list of common barnyard poultry:

  • Chickens
  • Ducks (domestic)
  • Geese
example.p: The preceding markup gives the following output.
Following is a list of common barnyard poultry:
Following is another good example of a simple list.

example.title: Example Short Phrase Simple List
example.p: Each error is comprised of the following elements:

ul.li: A code that identifies the type of error
A detail that might give additional details about the error
A message that describes the error condition
A type that identifies whether the error was from a receiver or sender
